intro: Psoralea linearis, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish to brownish flowers that are typically arranged in spikes, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Psoralea linearis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of drought-resistant flora.
